title: Strategies for Utilizing Computer Conferences for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning and professional development via computer conferencing in smartphone-dominant tech environments

learning_goals: Learners collaborate with three peer preservice teachers using computer conferencing tools (Zoom or Microsoft Teams) to co-create a lesson design draft within two weeks and submit a checklist verifying feedback incorporation.

Learners analyze at least three real-world applications of science education technology tools (AR/VR, AI-based simulations, etc.) in conference discussions and submit structured feedback meeting at least four out of five critique criteria: effectiveness, creativity, scalability.

Learners can propose three or more practical strategies (e.g., utilizing pre-recorded materials, applying cloud-based collaboration tools) to overcome technical limitations of computer conferences in smartphone environments (e.g., network latency, degraded screen-sharing quality) and develop a plan validated by peer assessment with an average of 4 or higher on a 5-point scale.

resources: Smartphone-Based Conference Platform (e.g., KakaoTalk Open Chat)
Science Education Technology Tool Example Materials
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
